intro: Fumaria pumila, commonly known as the dwarf yellow weed, is a low-growing annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural and urban environments.
